description: Change of use of single family dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to House in Multiple Occupation (Large HMO) comprising 6 rooms for up to 10 people (Use Class Sui Generis); rear roof extension, extending over outrigger and incorporating a juliet balcony; installation of two rooflights to front roof slope; single storey side/rear (wraparound) extension; first floor rear extension.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: AK/25/001 (Existing Plans, Elevations and Section); AK/25/002 R1 (Proposed Elevations, Section and Ground Floor Plan); AK/25/003 (Proposed First and Second Floor Plans).
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings listed under condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No part of the flat roof(s) of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

| The bicycle storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved HMO and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
REASON: To provide adequate cycle storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse and recycling storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved HMO and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

REASON: To provide adequate refuse facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing Council Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses, namely, bedrooms adjoining/below/above communal main entrance or kitchen/ living/ dining/ bathroom shall be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| The maximum number of persons occupying the hereby approved House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) shall be limited to no more than ten (10) persons within six (6) bedrooms.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development, in accordance with Policy D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the Council's HMO Licensing Guidelines.

building_details.building_ref: N/A - No new separate building being constructed.
